contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|kin}} '''Kin''' may refer to: * [[Kinship]] * [[Family]] {{tocright}} ==Places== * [[Kin, Okinawa]], a town in Okinawa, Japan * [[Kin, Pakistan]], a village along the Indus in Pakistan * [[Kin, Mogok]], a village in [[Mogok Township]], Burma (Myanmar) * [[Kin, Ye]], a village in Ye Township, Burma (Myanmar) * [[Kinshasa]], the capital and largest city of the Congo * [[Norman Manley International Airport]] in Kingston, Jamaica (IATA Code KIN) ==Music== * [[kin (album)|''kin'' (album)]], a 2012 album by iamamiwhoami * Kina Chinese [[musical instrument]] <!--<ref>Royall Tyler in Murasaki Shikibu, ''The Tale of Genji'', translated by Royall Tyler. introduction page xxvi. Penguin Classics. Reprint 2003. First published 2001. ISBN 0-14-243714-X</ref>--> ==Technology== * [[Microsoft Kin]], a family of social networking phones developed by Microsoft * [[Knowledge iN]], an online information-sharing service from Naver, a Korean web portal ==Other== * [[Kin (comics)]], a comic-book limited series created in 2000 by Gary Frank * [[Kin Canada]], a Canadian non-profit service organization * [[Kin (film)|''Kin'' (film)]], a 2000 UK/South Africa film directed by [[Elaine Proctor]] * [[Kin (short story)|"Kin" (short story)]], a 2006 Hugo nominated science fiction short story by Bruce McAllister * [[The Kin]], a group of women in ''The Wheel of Time'' * [[K'in]], one day in the Maya Calendar; also refers to the sun * [[Kin (mass)]], a Japanese unit of mass, 600 g * [[Kinyarwanda]] language ISO 639 code ==See also== * [[Kinh]], the majority ethnic group of Vietnam * [[Ken (disambiguation)]] * [[Kinism]] * [[KIN (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
